alert.note: Alert for Hertford (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 4:13PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Several clusters of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Camden, northwestern Pasquotank, northwestern Perquimans, Bertie, southeastern Hertford, central Gates and Chowan Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 412 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking clusters of thunderstorms along a line extending from near Winton to 6 miles north of Robersonville. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds to 30 to 40 mph. Rainfall up to 1 inch. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Ahoskie around 415 PM EDT. Winton and Cofield around 420 PM EDT. Harrellsville around 435 PM EDT. Gatesville around 445 PM EDT. Windsor and Ryland around 455 PM EDT. Sunbury and Hobbsville around 500 PM EDT. Belvidere around 510 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Goose Pond, Whites Crossroads, Tunis, Gliden, Horseshoe, Earleys, Newsome Store, Arrowhead Beach, Peach and Republican. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
